page.title: 04WILDLIFE
page.content: The area we visited was a coniferous plantation surrounding a golf course. Many species of birds use this plantation for nesting, shelter and food supplies. In a short walk we saw no less than ten differrent species, varying in size from Blue-tits to Rooks. In the fields Peewits and Oyster-catchers were nesting among the growing crops, while overhead the occasional Curlew was seen. Carrion crows are common as are Kestels hovering over their prey. Round the field-boundaries rabbits and their burrows were observed. Pheasant and Partridge are reared by some landowners for shooting. In the marshy areas to the east Mallard and Moorhen ducks were seen. The largest wild animals of the area are Roe deer and foxes are occasionally seen in the morning moving from wood to wood.
